result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Bobiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph A Bobiak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph A Bobiak was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: To Dodge County Drug Treatment Court, approving defendant to transfer his Drug Treatment Court to Dodge County.
Of right to seek postconviction relief, filed by defendant.
Filed by Defendant.
Impaired driving court stipulation and recommendation, filed by ADA Jordan Lippert.
Of right to preliminary hearing, filed by defendant.
Of right to attorney, filed by defendant.

1:20 PM Court called 22CF296 and 22TR3507.  Defendant Joseph A Bobiak in court without legal counsel.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by ADA Lippert.  Waiver to right to Attorney reviewed with defendant; court accepted waiver.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed; Court accepted waiver.  Court found probable cause, bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed; waived reading.  Court reviewed rights and elements.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1 of 22CF296.  Court accepted plea and found defendant guilty of count 1; judgment to be entered.  Count 2, 4 and 22TR3507 dismissed; Count 3 dismissed but read in.  Sentencing statements.  Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on probation for 24 months with conditions of probation to include: successfully complete Dodge County OWI Treatment Court Program; serve 60 days in the Columbia County Jail with Huber privileges subject to jail policies with good time allowed; Jail time to begin 10-20-2022 at 7:00 PM; may transfer to Dodge County; pay fines and costs of $1819 and $65 blood draw reimbursement fee; 24 month revocation of license; 24 month ignition interlock; complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations; submit DNA sample; maintain absolute sobriety.  2 days sentence credit.  Law enforcement to retain and properly dispose of firearm.  Adjourned at 1:53 PM.
Return date 10/20/2022 at 1:00 PM

10:05 AM Defendant Joseph A Bobiak in court.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lippert update court that defendant qualifies for Dodge County treatment court program. Defendant would like to participate in Dodge County treatment court. Matter to be reset. 10:13 AM
Return date scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date 10/13/22 at 10:00 AM
filed by defendant
filed by defendant

9:54 AM Defendant Joseph A Bobiak in court.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. 22TR3507 discussed by court and counsel. State moved to dismiss 22TR3507. Right to attorney, waived by defendant. Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. State mentioned the defendant was never given the option of drug treatment court. Court will recess to allow defendant time to discuss with the state. 10:10/10:26 Appearances the same. Defendant would like time to learn and look into the Dodge County OWI  treatment court. State agreed. The traffic case is to track with the criminal case. 10:32 AM
Return date scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date 10/13/22 at 10:00 AM
